intro: Ampelamus albidus, commonly known as the white-flowered bellvista, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its white petals are adorned with a distinctive yellow throat, adding to its ornamental value. Ampelamus albidus is often cultivated for its delicate appearance and ability to bloom in sunny conditions.
